intro: Lactuca praecox, commonly known as early lettuce, is an annual plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its rosette of broad, smooth leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a composite head. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Lactuca praecox is also known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Lactuca.
